text: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. I have had a very productive week. Ed and I spent most of the week getting the ceiling in the studioffice redone. We did this ourselves since it wasn’t hurricane damaged and covered by insurance like the kitchen ceiling was. Now I have to do a deep clean, clean-up to remove the mess that was made doing so, but the ceiling looks great. It has also been a very cold week here in the southeast, we are still dealing with the first floor heat pump problem and even got a dusting of snow that looked pretty on the deck before it was soon gone and turned into soft ice. Now the sun has returned and the temps are moving back up. :-) Posts You May Have Missed This Week: My kitchen has a new spacious look. (open in same tab) Something to Think About YES to this! (open in same tab) Life is too short! (open in same tab) As much as I have had to deal with from the aftermath of a hurricane damaging my home this past fall, it is teeny-tiny miniscule to the unimaginable loss of your entire home, all your belongings and the vibrant community you live in getting destroyed in a matter of hours. It is heartbreaking. Here are ways to help those who have lost everything this past week in the LA area. (open in same tab) “I have learned that our greatest blessings come when we are able to improve the lives of others.” – Jimmy Carter Oh… So Stylish Finds As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases. Ed got me this for Christmas and I have it draped around me as I write this post. It sure has come in handy to keep me warm with our heat pump not working. (open in same tab) I also got a red cashmere scarf for Christmas and have been getting compliments about how the color looks nice with my coloring. Hearing this had me go in search of a top/shirt to wear in red. I found this one that is just my style. (open in same tab) Stacking baskets like this are the best when trying to organize your stuff. (open in same tab) Battery-operated candles just keep getting better and better like these that are rechargeable. (open in same tab) If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here. And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more. html:
Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online.

I have had a very productive week. Ed and I spent most of the week getting the ceiling in the studioffice redone. We did this ourselves since it wasn’t hurricane damaged and covered by insurance like the kitchen ceiling was.

Now I have to do a deep clean, clean-up to remove the mess that was made doing so, but the ceiling looks great.

It has also been a very cold week here in the southeast, we are still dealing with the first floor heat pump problem and even got a dusting of snow that looked pretty on the deck before it was soon gone and turned into soft ice. Now the sun has returned and the temps are moving back up. :-)

Posts You May Have Missed This Week:

  • My kitchen has a new spacious look. (open in same tab)

Something to Think About

YES to this! (open in same tab)

Life is too short! (open in same tab)

As much as I have had to deal with from the aftermath of a hurricane damaging my home this past fall, it is teeny-tiny miniscule to the unimaginable loss of your entire home, all your belongings and the vibrant community you live in getting destroyed in a matter of hours. It is heartbreaking. Here are ways to help those who have lost everything this past week in the LA area. (open in same tab)


“I have learned that our greatest blessings come when we are able to improve the lives of others.” – Jimmy Carter

Oh… So Stylish Finds

As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.

  • Ed got me this for Christmas and I have it draped around me as I write this post. It sure has come in handy to keep me warm with our heat pump not working. (open in same tab)
  • I also got a red cashmere scarf for Christmas and have been getting compliments about how the color looks nice with my coloring. Hearing this had me go in search of a top/shirt to wear in red. I found this one that is just my style. (open in same tab)
  • Stacking baskets like this are the best when trying to organize your stuff. (open in same tab)
  • Battery-operated candles just keep getting better and better like these that are rechargeable. (open in same tab)

If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here.

And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more.
